graph_title: Proportion of children aged 24-59 months who are developmentally on track in health, learning and psychosocial well-being, by sex
indicator_name: Proportion of children aged 24-59 months who are developmentally on track in health, learning and psychosocial well-being, by sex
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys have access to quality early childhood development, care and pre‐primary education so that they are ready for primary education
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Proportion of children aged 24-59 months who are developmentally on track in health, learning and psychosocial well-being, by sex
methodology_global: The percentage of children at the start of primary school, typically age 6 years in many countries, who demonstrate age-appropriate health, learning and psychosocial well-being and possess the necessary competencies and knowledge required for learning in the early primary grades. The age at which children start primary school varies across countries. This means that the indicator may broadly reflect children's development between about five and seven years of age.
SDG_GOAL: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all
SDG_TARGET: By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys have access to quality early childhood development, care and pre‐primary education so that they are ready for primary education
SDG_INDICATOR: Proportion of children aged 24-59 months who are developmentally on track in health, learning and psychosocial well-being, by sex
